Contract title and description: OIP/0046-MP - Manufacture and In-Service Support
KPI name and description: Provision of Quotations for Tasks
Good target: No quotations delivered late during the reporting period.
Comments:
Due to the ongoing dynamics in the procurement market, the validity periods of WFEL?s sub-suppliers? offers are currently very limited. As a result, new offers have to be obtained even for supposedly standard services and materials, instead of using "old" sub-suppliers' offers. This step is necessary in order to make a serious price assessment and to minimise risks for all parties. Unfortunately, however, it leads to longer processing times for WFEL as the main contractor.
With a stabilisation of the markets, WFEL will again be able to demand and obtain longer validity periods from our suppliers and thus reduce its own processing time.

Contract title and description: RECRUITING PARTNERING CONTRACT-HQLF2/1739
KPI name and description: Recruitment of Regular Soldiers: Demand/Baseline Recruit Allocation Plan percentage
Comments: KPI 1 reflects Capita?s performance in recruiting soldiers to meet specific monthly targets across a wide range of job roles. With regards KPI 1, CAPITAs ability to achieve recruitment targets during Q1 has been impacted by the ongoing buoyant National jobs market that shows a high vacancy rate, with job postings some 43% above pre-pandemic levels, which means that Capita with the Army offer is competing against many other potential employers to attract recruits to fill these vacancies, whilst at the same time there has been a reduction in the size of the eligible target audience due to changing social demographics. To address these challenges,  Capita is working closely with the Army to drive a number of initiatives seeking to increase overall volumes and further improve conversion rates; these include the recent launch of a new Army website to attract potential candidates, and optimisation of current marketing activities to maximise engagement with main target audiences and generally raise the profile of the Army as an attractive career choice.

   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   • 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
   • 2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
   1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed

KPI name and description:
KPI1
   100% of the agreed contractual quarterly milestones have been submitted within the timeline of one week before end of quarter and have been approved by the SRO.  
   •	Milestones are submitted to FCDO at least one week before end of the quarter and subsequently approved by FCDO within one week of receipt.
   •	When any milestone is not met, quarterly reporting includes clear and concise narrative on areas on- and off-track; reasons for delays (within and outside project team control) and assessment of effects on project outputs and outcomes. 
   •	Where milestones are not achieved due to reasons outside project team control, CE will communicate/ provide justification within two weeks of the start of the quarter, and subject to FCDO SRO sign-off will not be included as part of bullet point 1.
   •	Milestones will be reviewed, and feedback shared by FCDO SRO within one week following receipt, and will allow for a one-week response time from CE following which a final scoring will be provided.
   Good: all milestones submitted on time and approved
   Approaching target: one milestone is not submitted or approved  within the deadline.
   Requires improvement: two Milestones are not submitted or approved within the deadline.
   Inadequate: more than two milestones are not submitted or approved within the deadline.
Good target: All milestones are submitted on time and approved by SRO within the deadline.

Contract title and description: Strengthening the teaching of primary school mathematics in Malawi
KPI name and description:
KPI2
   Set of  submitted quarterly milestones are of good quality as gauged by the Education Adviser (Technical criterion, weight at 50%) and by the Ministry of Education Director of Quality Assurance (government embedding and sustainability criterion, weight at 50%)
   The milestones are of good quality- i.e., technically strong and well embedded into government systems, facilitating government take-up and sustainability”
   1. Technical criterion- The Education Adviser will gauge the quality of submitted milestones as a whole (the set of milestones as a proxy for progress in implementation, not one by one) based on national and international evidence and given analysis of constraints and opportunities; it will also consider Value for Money and innovation. The Adviser will write a short memo accompanying the score (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
    2. Government embedding and sustainability criterion: the Director of Quality Assurance, who is the government coordinator for the programme, will have a quarterly meeting with FCDO which will be minuted, and score whether the set of milestones are embedding the programme in government systems and are considering sustainability (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
   Good: both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target
   Approaching target: both scores are approaching target or one is approaching target and one requires improvement.
   Requires improvement: both scores require improvement or one is requiring improvement and one is inadequate  
   Inadequate: Both scores are inadequate
Good target: Both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target

   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   • 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.

KPI name and description: Service Requirement ? Academic Registry - Undertake course administration. Performance Standard - Accurate Joining Instructions (JI?s) received by enrolled students by 20 Business Days prior to start of Courses.
Comments: A small number of comments in the recently completed Short Course Annual Review indicated that there may be recent instances where Joining Instructions did not reach all students in a timely manner. This could be due to some students registering late for their course or if they encountered technical difficulties not receiving Joining Instructions on a timely basis. Proposed Action Plan and timeframes: The Cranfield Service Delivery Manager will be included as a Blind Carbon Copy (Bcc) recipient on all future Student and Academic Support emails distributing Joining Instructions for Taught and Short Courses. This will assist with tracking any issues that arise with students not receiving Joining Instructions on a timely basis. Performance Period reflects May , June and July 2023 owing to the education term quarters.

Contract title and description: HO Central Postal Services-Premium
KPI name and description: End-to-End Deliveries - On-time mailing delivery to the recipient.
Comments:
Over the quarter from 27 March to 25 June 2023, Royal Mail delivered 94.3% of Second Class mail within three working days and 74.6% of First Class mail within one working day. High levels of staff absence and vacancies, amongst other factors, have affected operational performance and quality of service levels in Q1. 
Improving quality of service is one of Royal Mail’s top priorities. Plans to improve quality are already underway with targeted recruitment drives and a dedicated highly skilled performance team working with local units to improve quality.
The Business Recovery, Transformation and Growth Agreement - which was approved by a ballot of CWU members in July - provides a platform to improve operational performance and reduce absence. This includes new attendance and sickness policies, network changes and new seasonal working patterns to improve quality of service. 
Improving quality of service is a top priority. Royal Mail’s primary focus is to restore performance and deliver the high standards of service our customers expect.
